meanings.definition: The space on a coin below the main design, often used for inscriptions or dates.
meanings.sent1: The exergue on the coin displayed the year it was minted.
meanings.sent2: Numismatists study the exergue to learn more about the coin's history.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried to fit their name in the exergue of the coin.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were hidden in the exergue of the coin, waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The exergue was like a secret compartment holding valuable information.
